title: MUMPS -shared build error
body:
############ I use spack command, 

Spack install mumps%intel+complex+double+float~int64+metis+mpi+parmetis+ptscotch+scotch ~shared

I get an error when building static libs of MUMPS. 

############ The error is as below, 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
     24    ar vrlibpord.a graph.o gbipart.o gbisect.o ddcreate.o ddbisect.o nestdiss.o multisector.o gelim.o bucket.o tree.o symbfac.o interface.o sort.o minpriority.o
     25    ar: two different operation options specified
     26    Makefile:28: recipe for target 'libpord.a' failed
  >> 27    make[2]: *** [libpord.a] Error 1
     28    make[2]: Leaving directory '/tmp/MUMPS_5.1.1/PORD/lib'
     29    Makefile:66: recipe for target 'lib/libpord.a' failed
  >> 30    make[1]: *** [lib/libpord.a] Error 2
     31    make[1]: Leaving directory '/tmp/MUMPS_5.1.1'
     32    Makefile:22: recipe for target 's' failed
  >> 33    make: *** [s] Error 2
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

############ Platform and user environment

SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12 (x86_64) 
Linux x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

############ Additional information

--> Enabling shared option on is no problem. 

--> Spack spec -I is below,

     mumps%intel+complex+double+float~int64+metis+mpi+parmetis+ptscotch+scotch~shared
         ^bison%gcc
         ^cmake%gcc
         ^flex%intel
         ^gettext%gcc
         ^help2man%gcc
         ^m4%gcc
         ^metis%intel~int64~real64+shared
         ^parmetis%intel+shared
         ^pkgconf%gcc
         ^scotch%intel

############ Possible solution or Bug??? 

I had to change  spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/mumps/package.py file line 263, from 
'AR = ar vr' to 'AR = ar vr '. I inserted a space after vr that solved the error I mentioned above. After changing it, everything worked as it should be. 

--> Can you confirm if it is a bug or some feature intended? 

--> Also, Is there a way to build examples of MUMPS via spack install?
